department.dept_long_name: Committee on the Study of Religion

course.title: Witchcraft in Early Christianity
course.description: The course will examine the phenomena of witchcraft in selected early Christian texts to explore its socio-cultural and rhetorical implications by positing them within the broader context of Greco-Roman culture and society.
course.prerequisites: Two semesters of Greek are required.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 1555.
